body.p: All parts of the hindbrain and midbrain include both gray and white matter. Which part when sectioned would have a distinctive tree-branching shaped white matter pathway extending into folded gray matter cortex with increased surface area to quickly coordinate signals into and out of this brain part?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is part of the brainstem with central gray matter nuclei controlling some involuntary body functions.
Incorrect. This is part of the brainstem with central gray matter nuclei controlling some involuntary body functions.
Correct. The myelinated white matter of the cerebellum is arranged in the arbor vitae, which means “tree of life” .

Incorrect. This is part of the brainstem with central gray matter nuclei, including one that looks dark (substantia nigra) because of high levels of melanin and one that looks red (red nucleus) because of vasculature and high levels of iron.
Incorrect. This is a gray matter feature that extends from midbrain through the cerebellum, not a white matter structure.
